Solomon or Canticles__04.1: <u>How beautiful art thou</u>, my love, how beautiful art thou! thy eyes are doves' eyes, besides what is hid within. Thy hair is as flocks of goats, which Come up from mount Galaad.
Solomon or Canticles__04.2: Thy teeth as flocks of sheep, that are shorn which come up from the washing, all with twins, and there is none barren among them.
Solomon or Canticles__04.3: Thy lips are as a scarlet lace: and thy speech sweet. Thy cheeks are as a piece of a pomegranate, besides that which lieth hid within.
Solomon or Canticles__04.4: Thy neck, is as the tower of David, which is built with bulwarks: a thousand bucklers hang upon it, all the armour of valiant men.
Solomon or Canticles__04.5: <u>Thy two breasts</u>like two young roes that are twins, which feed among the lilies.
Solomon or Canticles__04.6: Till the day break, and the shadows retire, I will go to the mountain of myrrh, and to the hill of frankincense.
Solomon or Canticles__04.7: Thou art all fair, O my love, and there is not a spot in thee.
Solomon or Canticles__04.8: Come from Libanus, my spouse, come from Libanus, come: thou shalt be crowned from the top of Amana, from the top of Sanir and Hermon, from the dens of the lions, from the mountains of the leopards.
Solomon or Canticles__04.9: Thou hast wounded my heart, my sister, my spouse, thou hast wounded my heart with one of thy eyes, and with one hair of thy neck.
Solomon or Canticles__04.10: How beautiful are thy breasts, my sister, my spouse! thy breasts are more beautiful than wine, and the sweet smell of thy ointments above all aromatical spices.
Solomon or Canticles__04.11: Thy lips, my spouse, are as a dropping honeycomb, honey and milk are under thy tongue; and the smell of thy garments, as the smell of frankincense.
Solomon or Canticles__04.12: My sister, my spouse, is<u>a garden enclosed</u>, a garden enclosed,<u>a fountain sealed up</u>.
Solomon or Canticles__04.13: Thy plants are a paradise of pomegranates with the fruits of the orchard. Cypress with spikenard.
Solomon or Canticles__04.14: Spikenard and saffron, sweet cane and cinnamon, with all the trees of Libanus, myrrh and aloes with all the chief perfumes.
Solomon or Canticles__04.15: The fountain of gardens: the well of living waters, which run with a strong stream from Libanus.
Solomon or Canticles__04.16: Arise, O north wind, and come, O south wind, blow through my garden, and let the aromatical spices thereof flow.
